list_definition.definition: the bag-like organ in the body into which food passes when swallowed, and where most of it is digested
the part of the body between the chest and thighs; the belly.

list_ex_of_english: In any case we should be pouring the milk into the stomachs of the people instead of into the factories.
In some abattoirs, inspectors will examine "green offal"—stomachs and intestines—and in others they will not.
Only a short time later our stomachs have heaved again with a fresh sense of outrage.
In poor areas where very little can be spent on medical treatment, questions of intravenous feeding and operations putting tubes into people's stomachs never arise.
We ought to be addressing these questions and stop thinking we can help these people fill their stomachs simply by opening the borders.
They were not fit for youthful stomachs, so no steps were taken to distribute them to the children in the vicinity of the dockyard.
Frequency of arthropods in stomachs of tropical hummingbirds.
The majority of stomachs examined are empty, while remains from scats permit identification of prey only in broad taxonomic terms and do not include more digestible prey items.
